info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A THUNDERSTORM WITH TORRENTIAL RAINFALL WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL RABUN AND SOUTHERN MACON COUNTIES UNTIL 430 PM EDT... At 345 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm with torrential rainfall 8 miles southwest of Franklin, or 8 miles southeast of Nantahala Lake, moving southeast at 10 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Franklin, Wayah Bald, Otto, Rainbow Springs and Cullasaja. Very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: The combination of gusty winds and saturated soil conditions may cause scattered trees and power lines to fall. Seek shelter inside an interior room.
